column4: I have some questions about turning a Dell Precision 420 running Ubuntu 5.10 into a fileserver.
How do I get started?
I ahve googled and checked the Ubuntu forums.
Anyone...?
What do you mean?
you going to be using windows machines to access the backup server ?
you'll probably want to run samba so your client machines can connect to the server.
I'm totally new to this.
samba allows microsoft, mac, linux machines to share files.
Samba, huh? Google it?
there are howto's all over the place, best to find one for Ubuntu though
Just google it?
or you can search the ubuntu website as well
I've done that. I still ahve to try some of those things.
Do I need a fresh install?
no if you have ubuntu installed already you can simply install the software by doing sudo apt-get install samba
Ok, cool. Do I need any software on my other computers (Windows and Mac) to be able to access it? They're all connected via a router.
they should be able to talk once samba is set up.
Awesome. Can I also connect to it from another computer outside the LAN?
you don't want to open your samba server over the web, you normally would ssh or vpn into your network and access the files over an encrypted connection.
Ok. Sounds good. What's the best tutorial in your opinion? Is it buried somewhere in the Ubuntu site?
here's a good place to start >> https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SettingUpSamba?highlight=%28samba%29
